Merge pull request #6 from paulboone/sjs_multi_generation

@akaija just tested this on FRANK and it looks pretty good... except for the changes we talked about yesterday that you're working on.
use master now that everything is merged

Support multiple generations using hts_supervisor.py script, that runs on the head node to make sure the other processes are working. It is supposed to be very non-resource-intensive and spends most of its time sleeping. The hts_supervisor.py script replaces most of htsohm_hpc as well as the run_hpc script.
add qsub script
refactor to use subjobserver code; only run one generation

Commits prior to job server
fixed whitespace/typos in htsohm.py, mutate.py, and simulate.py

	htsohm/htsohm.py

reorganized imports in htsohm/generate.py
minor refactor of write_seed_def...(): reorganized dictionaries/appends, moved and renamed material_id to material_name
commented random_number_density to explain list and dictionary inputs
instead of deleting and re-writing config, additional parameters are update'd and dump'd in htsohm.generate
this file shouldn't be getting run directly from the shell anymore

each simulation now has a write_config step; uses ./output dir for all artifacts
simplify id_to_mat function
just use the sqlalchemy calls rather than wrapping them

use the primary key on the database as the identifier we use to look up the row; pass the full RunData row into the simulation methods in case they need access to results in the row. NOTE: this code does work with the overall HTSOHM script yet.

use .run and check=True to raise an exception when the underlying executable fails

use absolute package names
we separated out the direct call part of the HTSOHM file earlier
move files from ./bin to ./htsohm (unworking)
add newline after each CreateNumberOfMolecules line to prevent RASPA from giving random errors about 'Creating molecules for more systems than the maximum allowed'
assume simulate is on the PATH so RASPA can be installed anywhere
source the updated ~/.bashrc file into the console so we get all updated environment variables, rather than just exporting HTSOHM_DIR and RASPA_DIR
don't interpret HTSOHM_DIR / RASPA_DIR until the .bashrc is run so it is easier to edit for people with different configurations
